t: How*pn the Lord has overshadowed Daughter*ln Zion with his anger! He*ln has thrown down Israel’s glory from*ln heaven to earth. He*ln did not acknowledge his footstool in*ln the day of his anger.

Without*pn compassion the Lord has swallowed up all*ln the dwellings of Jacob. In*ln his wrath he has demolished the*ln fortified cities of Daughter Judah. He*ln brought them to the ground and*ln defiled the kingdom and its leaders.

He*pn has cut off every horn of Israel in*ln his burning anger and*ln withdrawn his right hand in*ln the presence of the enemy. He*ln has blazed against Jacob like a flaming fire that*ln consumes everything.

He*pn has strung his bow like an enemy; his*ln right hand is positioned like an adversary. He*ln has killed everyone who was the delight to the eye, pouring*ln out his wrath like fire on*ln the tent of Daughter Zion.

The*pn Lord is like an enemy; he*ln has swallowed up Israel. He*ln swallowed up all its palaces and*ln destroyed its fortified cities. He*ln has multiplied mourning and lamentation within*ln Daughter Judah.

He*pn has wrecked his temple as*ln if it were merely a shack in a field, destroying*ln his place of meeting. The*ln Lord*s has abolished appointed*ln festivals and Sabbaths in Zion. He*ln has despised king and priest in*ln his fierce anger.

The*pn Lord has rejected his altar, repudiated*ln his sanctuary; he*ln has handed the walls of her palaces over*ln to the enemy. They*ln have raised a shout in the house of the Lord*s as*ln on the day of an appointed festival.

The*pn Lord*s determined to destroy the*ln wall of Daughter Zion. He*ln stretched out a measuring line and*ln did not restrain himself from destroying. He*ln made the ramparts and walls grieve; together*ln they waste away.

Zion’s*pn gates have fallen to the ground; he*ln has destroyed and shattered the bars on her gates. Her*ln king and her leaders live among the nations, instruction*ln is no more, and*ln even her prophets receive no*ln vision from the Lord.*s

The*pn elders of Daughter Zion sit*ln on the ground in silence. They*ln have thrown dust on their heads and*ln put on sackcloth. The*ln young women of Jerusalem have*ln bowed their heads to the ground.

My*pn eyes are worn out from weeping; I*ln am churning within. My*ln heart is poured out in grief because*ln of the destruction of my dear people, because*ln infants and nursing babies faint in*ln the streets of the city.
They*pn cry out to their mothers, “Where*ln is the grain and wine?” as*ln they faint like the wounded in*ln the streets of the city, as*ln their life pours out in*ln the arms of their mothers.

What*pn can I say on your behalf? What*ln can I compare you to, Daughter Jerusalem? What*ln can I liken you to, so*ln that I may console you, Virgin Daughter Zion? For*ln your ruin is as vast as the sea. Who*ln can heal you?

Your*pn prophets saw visions for you that*ln were empty and deceptive; they*ln did not reveal your iniquity and*ln so restore your fortunes. They*ln saw pronouncements for you that*ln were empty and misleading.

All*pn who pass by scornfully*ln clap their hands at you. They*ln hiss and shake their heads at*ln Daughter Jerusalem: Is*ln this the city that was called the*ln perfection of beauty, the*ln joy of the whole earth?
All*pn your enemies open*ln their mouths against you. They*ln hiss and gnash their teeth, saying,*ln “We have swallowed her up. This*ln is the day we have waited for! We*ln have lived to see it.”

The*pn Lord*s has done what he planned; he*ln has accomplished his decree, which*ln he ordained in days of old. He*ln has demolished without compassion, letting*ln the enemy gloat over you and*ln exalting the horn of your adversaries.
The*pn hearts of the people cry out to the Lord. Wall*ln of Daughter Zion, let*ln your tears run down like a river day*ln and night. Give*ln yourself no relief and*ln your eyes no rest.

Arise,*pn cry out in the night from*ln the first watch of the night. Pour*ln out your heart like water before*ln the Lord’s presence. Lift*ln up your hands to him for*ln the lives of your children who*ln are fainting from hunger at*ln the head of every street.

Lord,*spn look and consider to*ln whom you have done this. Should*ln women eat their own children, the*ln infants they have nurtured? Should*ln priests and prophets be*ln killed in the Lord’s sanctuary?

Both*pn young and old are*ln lying on the ground in the streets. My*ln young women and young men have*ln fallen by the sword. You*ln have killed them in the day of your anger, slaughtering*ln without compassion.

You*pn summon those who terrorize me on every side, as*ln if for an appointed festival day; on*ln the day of the Lord’s*s anger no*ln one escaped or survived. My*ln enemy has destroyed those*ln I nurtured and reared.
